description: The apparent Israeli attack has killed at least 37 people and injured thousands more, reports Justin Salhani from Beirut.
title: ‘It Sounded Like Gunfire.’ Lebanese Reel From Deadly Pager and Radio Blasts

description: In recent decades it has become widely recognized as a symbol of Palestinian nationalism and resistance.
title: The History of the Kaffiyeh

description: "With managers and leaders, the vast majority are unfit for their roles," writes Barry Conchie and Sarah Dalton.
title: The Plague of Mediocre Leadership

description: I was writing about unexplained ailments. Then I experienced my own.
title: I Was Writing About a Medical Mystery. Then I Experienced My Own

description: Robinson said he won’t be forced out by “salacious tabloid lies” after a report that he posted strongly worded racial and sexual comments on an online message board.
title: North Carolina Republican Mark Robinson Vows to Stay in Governor Race Despite New Scandal

description: While it is rare for foreign policy differences between the political parties to affect electoral outcomes, it has happened before.
title: Foreign Policy Issues Don’t Often Decide U.S. Elections. This Year Could Be Different

description: “Unfortunately, neither major candidate was able to make serious commitments to our union to ensure the interests of working people are always put before Big Business."
title: Teamsters Union Declines to Endorse Trump or Harris for President

description: Sean 'Diddy' Combs was sent to the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, a place that’s been described as “hell on earth."
title: Inside the Brooklyn Federal Jail Where Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Is Locked Up: Violence, Squalor, and Death

description: Springfield, Ohio was transformed overnight into a target for the nation's vitriol.
title: Residents of Springfield, Ohio, Pray for Political Firestorm to Blow Over

description: In the absence of reproductive freedom, Black women historically went to great lengths to be self-determining, sometimes with wrenching results.
title: Why Kamala Harris’ Promises on Abortion Matter So Much to Black Women

description: The real story behind Ryan Murphy's new Menendez brothers true-crime drama.
title: The True Story Behind Ryan Murphy’s Menendez Brothers Series

description: The unpleasant gut condition is strangely hot on social media.
title: Why Does Everyone Seem to Have IBS Now?

description: Disclosing a prostate cancer diagnosis can make some men vulnerable, but it has the potential to open up outlets for support.
title: Why Some Men Keep Their Prostate Cancer a Secret

description: Today, TIME unveils TIME Votes, a new editorial platform dedicated to exploring the key issues and motivations defining the 2024 Presidential Election.
title: New ‘TIME Votes’ Platform Provides Service-Oriented Journalism and Non-Partisan Resources for the 2024 Presidential Election

description: With ‘Intermezzo’ comes the latest wave of envy and desire to replicate the superstar author’s sales and popularity. But she stands alone.
title: There Will Never Be Another Sally Rooney

description: As trust in major institutions declines, people are increasingly persuaded to vote by those in their social networks.
title: 11 Things to Say to Persuade Someone to Vote

description: US election officials in rural and urban jurisdictions of four battleground states hold the line against organized efforts to undermine their work as they prepare for the contentious 2024 contest.
title: THE OFFICIALS Presented by TIME Studios

description: When Ben Nimmo first began tracking online influence operations targeting elections in 2014, he had to scroll for hours on Twitter, studying how networks of fake accounts tried to hijack partisan narratives. A decade later, AI is changing the game—not just for foreign threat actors, but for those working to counter them. “So much of…
title: Ben Nimmo

description: For Cisco Aguilar, the job of Secretary of State is that of a referee. Perhaps that mindset originated from his years as chairman of the Nevada Athletic Commission. Perhaps it comes from the teachings of his grandfather, a union leader in the Nevada mines, who taught him to speak up for his community. All of…
title: Cisco Aguilar

description: Voting booths had been closed for less than 24 hours four years ago when Ken Block’s phone rang. On the other end was a lawyer from the Donald Trump campaign in need of a data pro who could help suss out voter fraud, possibly enough to keep the President in the White House for a…
title: Ken Block

description: Votebeat is the only news outlet in America that exclusively reports on elections and voting at the local level. It’s journalists are more concerned with the process of elections—as opposed to candidates or campaigns—and keep up with their reporting in off-years when other outlets move on to other topics. “That is a key strength of…
title: Chad Lorenz

description: More Americans voted in the 2020 election than in any other in U.S. history. In the four years since, 18 states have enacted new or stricter voter ID requirements to cast a ballot, warns Lauren Kunis, the executive director and CEO of VoteRiders. “The history of our country is one of expanding access to the…
title: Lauren Kunis

description: In 1964, Courtland Cox was among hundreds of college students who traveled to Mississippi to help register Black people to vote, drawing strong opposition from the state’s segregationists. The project, known as Freedom Summer, was a turning point in the civil rights movement. Sixty years later, Cox, 83, is working with the NAACP to mobilize…
title: Courtland Cox

description: Lucille Wenegieme sees her job as a straightforward one: “We turn music fans into voters.” That’s the mission statement of Headcount, which leverages the fan bases of some of the world’s biggest artists to get out the vote. In two decades, Headcount has grown from a small, grassroots initiative, best known for working with jam…
title: Lucille Wenegieme

description: This summer, Stephen Richer, the county recorder in Maricopa County, Ariz., ran for re-election as an unabashedly pro-democracy Republican. That was a bold stance in Maricopa, which had been overrun by baseless allegations of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 and 2022 elections. Richer spent the past four years defending the integrity of his county’s…
title: Stephen Richer

description: After Steve Ballmer retired as the chief executive officer of Microsoft in 2014, his wife suggested he join her in her philanthropic work with foster children. He had thought it was mostly the government’s responsibility, but his wife told him, “We can do a little more, a little better,” he recalls. He soon found himself…
title: Steve Ballmer

description: Icom Inc., whose brand appears on devices that exploded in Lebanon, said it halted production a decade ago of the model allegedly used in the attacks.
title: Japanese Brand on Exploding Walkie-Talkies Says They Haven’t Made the Devices for 10 Years

description: The Prime Minister talks with TIME about his balancing act at home and abroad and the lessons he says he learned from his past imprisonment.
title: What Does Anwar Ibrahim Stand for? Malaysia’s PM on His Balancing Act at Home and Abroad

description: The announcement is the latest U.S. government effort to call out what officials say is Iran’s brazen, ongoing work to interfere in the election.
title: FBI Says Iranian Hackers Tried to Pass Stolen Trump Campaign Info to Biden Campaign

description: Disney+ delivers a long-awaited 'WandaVision' sequel that caters to fans Marvel rarely seems to please. It's delightful. But is it doomed?
title: Agatha All Along Is Loads of Clever, Campy, Witchy Fun
